lines.text:
[Flirting]
Do you ever go out with gentlemen?
lines.character: Fat Man Who Flirts With Dolly

lines.text: I never met one.
Do you want a number, Madam?

[Knowingly]
I've got your number. That's all I need.

[to Angel Face]
I never realized how uninteresting cement was until I met you.

[Working at a "Ritzy" Hotel's Telephone Switchboard]
No, Madam - the pool room is not for swimming.
Men are that way - seems like there's no chance for a poor girl to make an honest living. There's no use crying - I always take things as I find them.
Just to prove that all men are not alike - I'll stake you to twenty bucks.
Thanks, Brad - you're one white guy.
What's the idea - giving another dame money?
You know how I am, honey - generous to a fault.
The dough's gone!
I knew that dame was dishonest!

[Referring to a singing wheel chair taxi porter]
He reminds me of the darkies singing down home on the plantation.
Are plantations very expensive?
Some of them are worth a million dollars.
Where's my dough?
Oh, you mean our dough - that you forgot to divide.
[Looks for it, can't find it]
A complete washout. I must have lost it. Just to prove that all women are not alike - I'll stake you to twenty bucks.
Oh, we'll forget the small change - now that you've lined up a new sucker.
A dame like that ought to be in jail. She's a menace to society.
So this is the plantation.
Oh, no, the plantation is next door. It's Colonel Winthrop's plantation - but we enjoy looking over the cotton fields.
That's just like owning it - except that Colonel Winthrop pays the taxes.
There they are, honey - just like I said - the darkies singing on the plantation.
Yes, on Colonel Winthrop's plantation.
Don't worry about him, Ma. All married people act goofy.
What do you think you're going to gain by coming here, Bradley?
We're merely trying to find out why a gink with a million bucks lives in a shanty like this.
He isn't rich - he hasn't a dime. Of course you wouldn't understand, but I love this guy.

[laughs hysterically - Commenting to Gwen]
She slays me!
This joint don't look like ready money to me.
Maybe it's one of them antique joints.
I told you I was through with the racket - and I meant it!
Applesauce! You're just tryin' to keep this sucker for your private pickin'.
Listen, Angel Face, if you don't snap out of the glooms - you're going to queer this whole deal.
